text:
n_features = 1
n_seq = 2
n_steps = 2
X = X.reshape((X.shape[0], n_seq, 1, n_steps, n_features))
Listing 9.23: Example of reshaping data for a ConvLSTM model.
We can deﬁne the ConvLSTM as a single layer in terms of the number of ﬁlters and a two-
dimensional kernel size in terms of (rows, columns). As we are working with a one-dimensional
series, the number of rows is always ﬁxed to 1 in the kernel. The output of the model must
then be ﬂattened before it can be interpreted and a prediction made.
